This page explains how we communicate internally and with the external world.

==== Internal Communication ====

=== Mailing List ===

There is one list for internal communication, attached to the Launchpad project:

** <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuconeu|ubucon-eu]]</nowiki>

The Launchpad-Group is public and managed by <nowiki>[[svij]]</nowiki>.

=== IRC ===

We have an ICR channel on Freenode:

** '''#ubucon-eu''' on '''irc.freenode.net'''

<nowiki>[[sturmflut]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[svij]]</nowiki> currently have operator rights, it is a registered channel.

=== Wiki ===

The Wiki is at the moment mostly managed by <nowiki>[[sturmflut]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[svij]]</nowiki> or the responsible manager of a <nowiki>[[http://wiki.ubucon.de/doku.php/ubucon:2016:tasks|task]]</nowiki>.

==== External communication ====

=== E-Mail ===

We PLAN TO offer multiple contact addresses for specific topics:

** Registration for and visits to Ubucon: visitors@ubucon.eu
** Proposals for talks, workshops and speakers: ideas@ubucon.eu
** Helping to run Ubucon Europe: helpers@ubucon.eu
** Press relations: press@ubucon.eu
** Sponsoring and financial support: sponsors@ubucon.eu
** The orga team: team@ubucon.eu
** Feedback: feedback@ubucon.eu

All addresses WILL LIKELY BE forwarded to mailing lists:

** <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu-eu.org/mailman/listinfo/besucher-ubucon-eu|visitors-ubucon-eu]]</nowiki> (Registration and visiting Ubucon Europe)
** <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu-eu.org/mailman/listinfo/idee-ubucon-eu|idea-ubucon-eu]]</nowiki> (Proposals for talks, workshops and speakers)
** <nowiki>[[http://lists.ubuntu-eu.org/mailman/listinfo/ubucon-eu|ubucon-eu]]</nowiki> (the rest)

The mailing lists will not be public and currently <nowiki>[[user>svij]]</nowiki> manages the overall mailing list area.
